column5: Well finally set up a time I could fish with the Mercman.So Friday night I accepted an invite from Paul To go fishing on the St.Lawrence.Now I have been in a lot of boats before and Paul is Mr.Organized I have never seen such a well organized boat.I did bring him to my lucky spot and we did just fine considering we were only out for a couple of hours.Caught five walleye if you count the little dinker and my sheep herding skills came back to haunt me as I picked up a 4 to 5lb sheepy which I released boat side.  Just a couple of pics.Thanks Paul for taking me out I had a great time fishing with you.Until next time.   this is Paul's PB walleye Petit Baby.
Well they can only get bigger from now on Paul.
You Rat !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I swear, i didnt think they made them that small It was so small i just stared at it and LMAO... Had a great time Mike, looking forward to doing it again.
Any fish is a fish. As long as you have fun.
congrats on the PB Paul  You must have a really sensitive rod to feel that behemoth bite
Sounds like a good time. Paul, you should have held it out at arm's length.
Kistler Lithium II LTX .Almost burnt the drag off my Currado
So I see the slump is over...lmao...   Looks like fun Paul...
Ya.laff it up mister

Did you have a net to handle that hog.......  Let me guess.....you deep fried it whole and put it on a hot dog roll (you know us American's with hot dogs)....  Rumour has it I might someday fish with Pauly.....
You just went on the list:w00t:
Any measurements on the brute Paul? Sounds like a fun   outing
If we call small walleyes cigars would it be appropriate to call that a spliff?
15 INCHES BELOW SLOT
You the man Paul
I am
There's a 'list'?
At least he didn't volunteer to be put on the "LIST"....
Guess they missed it Rob. Now pass please.
Great walleye! I have never caught one small enough to "lip" before. There should be a prize for that.
As long as you had a good time, size doesn't matter.
